com.here.mobility.sdk.core.services.timezone

Class TimeZoneClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • <any>
      • com.here.mobility.sdk.core.services.timezone.TimeZoneClient

  • public final class TimeZoneClient
extends <any>
    The client class that find a timezones for the given location and an optional time for future DST calculation.
    Code example: 
    
 		Calendar calendar = Calendar.getInstance(java.util.TimeZone.getTimeZone("UTC"));
 		calendar.set(Calendar.YEAR, year);
 		calendar.set(Calendar.MONTH, month);
 		calendar.set(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH, dayOfMonth);
 		calendar.set(Calendar.MINUTE, minute);
 		calendar.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, hourOfDay);
 		TimeZoneClient client = TimeZoneClient.newInstance();
 		LatLng location = LatLng.fromDegrees(lat, lng);
 		ResponseFuture<TimeZone> timeZoneFuture = client.findTimeZone(location, calendar.getTimeInMillis());
 		timeZoneFuture.registerListener(new ResponseListener<TimeZone>() {

 			public void onResponse(TimeZone timeZone) {
 				// Use the updated time zone.
 			}

 			public void onError(ResponseException exception) {
 				// Handle errors.
 			}
 		});

 		// Don't forgot call shutdownNow.
 		// client.shutdownNow();

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ResponseFuture<TimeZone> findTimeZone(LatLng latLng, Long timeInMillis)
      Requests a TimeZone for the specified LatLng and an optional time for future DST calculation.

      Creates a new TimeZoneClient.

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static TimeZoneClient newInstance()
        Creates a new TimeZoneClient.

      • findTimeZone

        public ResponseFuture<TimeZone> findTimeZone(LatLng latLng,
                                             Long timeInMillis)
        Requests a TimeZone for the specified LatLng and an optional time for future DST calculation. This request can throw the following exceptions: HMTimeZoneNotFoundException UserAuthenticationException
        Parameters:
        latLng - is the request LatLng to find a timezone.
        timeInMillis - time in millis without any time zone shifting Can be retrieve by set a Calendar and call Calendar.getTimeInMillis()
